title: Measuring an RLC Series Circuit with DMM and Oscilloscope

pages.notes:
For this circuit:
   R1 = [Math.round(r1.resistance)] ohms
   R2 = [Math.round(r2.resistance)] ohms
   R3 = [Math.round(r3.resistance)] ohms
   R4 = [Math.round(r4.resistance)] ohms
   C1 = [Math.round(10*c1.capacitance * 1000000)/10] microf
   L1 =[ Math.round(10*l1.inductance * 1000) / 10] milihenries

questions.prompt: Use the function generator to change the frequency and measure the voltages across all the different components using either the multimeter or the oscilloscope (or both). Then answer the questions below.

subquestions.prompt: Does the voltage across R<sub>1</sub> change when you change the frequency?
subquestions.shortPrompt: Does the voltage across R<sub>1</sub> change when you change the frequency?

subquestions.prompt: Does the voltage across R<sub>4</sub> change when you change the frequency?
subquestions.shortPrompt: Does the voltage across R<sub>4</sub> change when you change the frequency?

subquestions.prompt: Do the voltages across R<sub>1</sub>, R<sub>2</sub>, and R<sub>3</sub> add up to the voltage put out by the function generator?
subquestions.shortPrompt: Do the voltages across R<sub>1</sub>, R<sub>2</sub>, and R<sub>3</sub> add up to the voltage put out by the function generator?

subquestions.prompt: Do the voltages across R<sub>4</sub>, C, and L add up to the voltage put out by the function generator?
subquestions.shortPrompt: Do the voltages across R<sub>4</sub>, C, and L add up to the voltage put out by the function generator?
